Bio

Stats

Historical

Biography

2019-20 (Junior)

Played in 27 games and started in 20 games...Averaged 4.6 points per game and 3.4 rebound per game…Had career-highs in points with eight at Drexel (11/8)...Had first career block at Rutgers (11/10)...Tied a then-career-high in points with eight and grabbed a career-high six rebounds at Stephen F. Austin (11/13)...Scored a then-career-high 10 points at St. Bonaventure (12/18)...Tied a then-career-high in rebounds with a team-high six at Buffalo (12/21)...Set career-highs in points with 11, in rebounds with eight, and in blocks with three at Monmouth (1/24)...Had a team-high seven rebounds versus Marist (1/31).

Before Niagara

Kratholm spent last season attending Miami Dade College where he averaged 10.2 points and 6.5 rebounds per game. He was a member of the Duquesne Dukes program for the 2017-18 season where he saw action in nine games.Prior to Duquesne, he played one season at the IMG Academy in Bradenton, Florida. He was second on the team in scoring (13.0 ppg) and rebounding (5.5 rpg) on a squad that went 23.7. Kratholm, who intends to study in the bio-technology field, attended Waggener High School in St, Mathews, Kentucky. He was the class valedictorian and was a two-time recipient of the Waggener’s Outstanding Character Award (2013 & 2015). He was twice named to the regional all-tournament team and was a member of the Junior All-Star team in 2015, and twice received Crusader Classic All-Tournament honors.
